SENT.plain: We are reporting a systemic lupus erythematosus patient with antiphospholipid syndrome who developed iliofemoral thrombosis
Before the occurrence of iliofemoral venous thrombosis, antiphospholipid antibodies (aPL) gradually decreased over a period of 18 weeks but were within normal range during its acute phase
In the course of two years following this case of thrombosis, aPL have never returned to the high prethrombotic values
It is therefore most likely that aPL were involved in the process of provoking thrombosis rather than being consumed during its acute phase
